result.execSummary:
The defendant Lynn M. Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lynn M. Krueger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lynn M. Krueger was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation no later than 4:00 p.m. on 7/5/2016.
Must follow rules of Probation.
Concurrent with: Other periods of Probation

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to Probation while on Probation.

$15,269.17 Restitution, plus 10% surcharge of $1,526.92, for a total of $16,796.09, to be paid to Probation while on Probation.  Bond to be applied.  Balance may be reduced to a civil judgment without further hearing if Defendant makes a good-faith attempt to pay.
Must pay a $250.00 DNA surcharge to Probation while on Probation.
Subject to Work Release.  NOT subject to Good Time.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.
If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
NO contact with Joseph Polaski.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
